channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: America loves to eat. But a third of its food still goes in the trash
item.description: Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.
item.content:encoded: Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Soleil, a Belgian sheepdog, takes Best in Show at the National Dog Show
item.description: The National Dog Show, televised annually on Thanksgiving Day, is a beloved tradition for many families. This year, Soleil, a Belgian sheepdog, was crowned Best in Show.
item.content:encoded:
The National Dog Show, televised annually on Thanksgiving Day, is a beloved tradition for many families. This year, Soleil, a Belgian sheepdog, was crowned Best in Show.

(Image credit: National Dog Show)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: What was 'Operation Allies Welcome,' which allowed some Afghans entry into the U.S.?
item.description: The Afghan man suspected of shooting two National Guard members entered the U.S. under the program in 2021. Here's a look at why it was set up and how those who entered the U.S. were vetted.
item.content:encoded:
The Afghan man suspected of shooting two National Guard members entered the U.S. under the program in 2021. Here's a look at why it was set up and how those who entered the U.S. were vetted.

(Image credit: Anthony Peltier)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Fuzzy Zoeller, golf champion haunted by racist joke about Tiger Woods, dies at 74
item.description: Two-time golf champion Fuzzy Zoeller has died at the age of 74. One of golf's most gregarious characters Zoeller's career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke he made about Tiger Woods.
item.content:encoded:
Two-time golf champion Fuzzy Zoeller has died at the age of 74. One of golf's most gregarious characters Zoeller's career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke he made about Tiger Woods.

(Image credit: Morry Gash)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: National Guard shooting suspect served in CIA counterterrorism unit, group says
item.description: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the Afghan man who allegedly shot two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., had served in one of Afghanistan's elite counterterrorism units, according to a nonprofit run by people who served in Afghanistan.
item.content:encoded:
Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the Afghan man who allegedly shot two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., had served in one of Afghanistan's elite counterterrorism units, according to a nonprofit run by people who served in Afghanistan.

(Image credit: U.S. Attorney’s Office)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom has died from injuries after D.C. shooting
item.description: Beckstrom, 20, was an Army specialist from Summersville, W.Va. She entered the service in 2023. President Trump said the second Guard member who was shot, Andrew Wolfe, "is fighting for his life."
item.content:encoded:
Beckstrom, 20, was an Army specialist from Summersville, W.Va. She entered the service in 2023. President Trump said the second Guard member who was shot, Andrew Wolfe, "is fighting for his life."

(Image credit: U.S. Attorney’s Office)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Michel Martin reflects on Thanksgiving. And, revisit Susan Stamberg's cranberry relish
item.description: Thanksgiving has a complicated origin story, but it remains a great opportunity to express gratitude. Morning Edition host Michel Martin explains why that is.
item.content:encoded: Thanksgiving has a complicated origin story, but it remains a great opportunity to express gratitude. Morning Edition host Michel Martin explains why that is.
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Two National Guard members were shot in a "targeted attack" in D.C., Georgia election interference case against Trump, allies dismissed, U.S. envoy to return to Moscow for new Ukraine peace talks.
item.content:encoded: Two National Guard members were shot in a "targeted attack" in D.C., Georgia election interference case against Trump, allies dismissed, U.S. envoy to return to Moscow for new Ukraine peace talks.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: This artist designs intricate suits of armor. The intended wearer? A humble mouse
item.description: Jeff de Boer has made an entire career out of crafting tiny plate armor. He's compelled by the idea of the underdog finding an edge; something so small being so well-protected.
item.content:encoded:
Jeff de Boer has made an entire career out of crafting tiny plate armor. He's compelled by the idea of the underdog finding an edge; something so small being so well-protected.

(Image credit: Chona Kasinger)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Mamdani and Trump made nice. NYC immigrants are still on edge
item.description: The incoming mayor of New York City has had a volatile relationship with President Trump. They recently had a surprisingly cordial meeting. New Yorkers say they are still feeling on edge.
item.content:encoded:
The incoming mayor of New York City has had a volatile relationship with President Trump. They recently had a surprisingly cordial meeting. New Yorkers say they are still feeling on edge.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd
